abstracts.cdata!:
For the past five years, the Government
            of Egypt and the World Bank have worked together on the most
            far-reaching, substantive and comprehensive drive toward
            financial sector strengthening so far in Egypt and the Arab
            World. This partnership has led to tangible results, most
            notably reflected in the fact that the banking sector in
            Egypt is now majority-owned by the private sector and open
            to competition, and resilient to the adverse consequences of
            the global financial crisis.
